triples.name: Spatial Ecology
triples.relevance: The paper integrates spatial behavior of animals with social behavior, using spatial ecology as a foundational framework.

triples.name: Behavioral Ecology
triples.relevance: The paper builds on behavioral ecology concepts to understand how social and spatial behaviors interact in animal populations.

triples.name: Pathogen Transmission
triples.relevance: The paper identifies pathogen transmission as an ecological process influenced by spatial-social interfaces.

triples.name: Population Dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper discusses how spatial-social interfaces influence population dynamics through mutual causes and shared consequences.

triples.name: Graph Theory
triples.relevance: Graph theory is explicitly mentioned as a key approach for integrating social and spatial processes in the analysis.

triples.name: Habitat Selection
triples.relevance: The paper uses density-dependent habitat selection as an example of how spatial and social processes are interconnected.

triples.name: Ecological Niche
triples.relevance: Niche specialization is mentioned as a key concept linking social and spatial behavioral ecology.

triples.name: Migration (ecology)
triples.relevance: Movement ecology is highlighted as a key tool for linking the spatial-social interface in animal behavior.

triples.name: Social Evolution
triples.relevance: The paper discusses the evolution of social systems as an outcome of spatial-social interface interactions.
